Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino

Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq - Nível 1B

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5464365539060185
  • Última atualização do currículo em 19/07/2019

She has PhD and Master degrees in Astronomy from University of São Paulo. Post-doctorates at the University of Harvard (with the prestigious scholarship granted by BID to only 20 researchers of the University of Sao Paulo), and University of Berkeley (USA). She was also awarded a position as Associate-Researcher at International Center for Theoretical Physics in Trieste (ICTP), Italy, 1994-2001. Visiting professor at the University of Princeton, University of Wisconsin (USA), Universidad Autónoma de Mexico, University of Pisa (Italy), University of Jerusalem, Observatory of Nice, Obs. Paris-Meudon (France), Obs. of Arcetri and Obs. of Bologna (Italy). She is free-professor and Associate-Professor III (equivalent to full-professor) at IAG, University of São Paulo (IAG/USP). One of Brazilian PIs of CTA (Cherenkov Telescope Array) Project. Brazilian PI of ASTRI-CTA Mini-Array Project. Member of the Stearing Committee of Astroparticle Physics of the International Union of Pure & Applied Physics (IUPAP, 2014-2018). Coordinator of 3 Thematic Projects FAPESP (2004; 2009; and currently). Coordinator of FAPESP Multiuser Project that acquired SUPER CLUSTER Alpha-Crucis for the Laboratory of Astro-informatics (LAi, IAG / USP, 2009-2011) within 5 biggest in Brazil. She was President of the Post-Graduation Program of IAG-USP (2008-2009); Coordinator of the Post-Graduate Program of the Department of Astronomy, IAG-USP (2005-2010), Stearing Committee Member of Interstellar Matter Division of International Astronomical Union (IAU, 2006-2012). Reviewer of Italian Super-Computing Resource Allocation (ISCRA). Member of evaluation board of CAPES (2009). PI of FAPESP Project USP-Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Magnetic Field Effects and Particle Acceleration in Gamma-Ray Bursts); PI of Project USP-Princeton University (Unveiling the Universe with Galaxy Surveys and Magnetohydrodynamical Studies). Participated in PLANCK SATELLITE CONSORTIUM (for Cosmological studies of cosmic magnetic fields). Executive and Advisory Committee member of LLAMA Project (Long Latin American Millimeter Array) Brazil-Argentina. Member of GEMINI / NICI extrasolar planet finding campaign (2008-2013). She organized or co-organized several international conferences. She has experience on High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics, with emphasis in High-Performance Computation Magnetohydrodynamics, with applications on interstellar medium, stellar and extragalactic astrophysics and cosmology, with more than 100 papers in the most important journals of Astrophysics and related fields. She holds the Jabuti Award for Scientific Book. She was awarded the Claudia Prize of Woman in Science (2017). Supervised doctoral thesis with Honors-Award CAPES, and two Best Thesis in Astronomy of IAG/USP. É bolsista do CNPq de produtividade (nível 1B since 2013). (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2014 - Atual
Investigation of High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics Phenomena: Theory, Numerical Simulations, Observations, and Instrument Development for the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA), Thematic Project FAPESP
Descrição: The High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics group of E. M. de Gouveia Dal Pino of the Instituto de Astronomia, Geologia e Ciências Atmosféricas da Universidade de São Paulo (IAG-USP), A. B. M. Valio of the Centro de Radioastronomia e Astrofísica da Universidade Mackenzie (CRAAM), and Diego Falceta Goncalves of EACH-USP, have been developing for more than a decade several correlated projects using theoretical and numerical magneto-hydrodynamics (MHD) fluid description, as well as observational tools, to investigate astrophysical plasmas and high energy phenomena. In the recent years, our group has been also involved in the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) Project, an international collaboration (involving 26 countries) aiming the construction of a new generation of ground-based gamma-ray telescopes, between 2016-2020. CTA will provide the deepest ever insight into the non-thermal, high-energy universe and allow significant contributions to cosmology, astroparticle physics and, in particular, to cosmic ray accelerators, cosmic magnetic fields and gamma-ray burst (GRB) investigation. In this proposal we got funding from FAPESP to support the construction of 3 Cherenkov telescopes to complete the ASTRI-CTA Mini-Array, in partnership with INAF- Italy and South-Africa. This Mini-Array of 7 telescopes will be the precursor and the core of the full CTA. The participation in the Mini-Array construction will ensure to the Brazilian members a solid involvement with the CTA Besides, in view of the extensive number of related projects being developed by our group, we also obtained funding to upgrade our computational facilities with a clustar of over 700 cores. (Thematic Project FAPESP 2013/10559-5).
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (2) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Falceta-Gonçalves, D. - Integrante / Adriana Valio - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - Atual
USP-PRINCETON University: ?Unveiling the Universe with Galaxy Surveys and Magnetohydrodynamical Studies?
Descrição: This involves E.M. de Gouveia Dal Pino and Laerte Sodre Jr.?s groups (both PIs for IAG-USP) and James Stone?s and Michael Strauss? groups from Princeton University side. This project, just approved among several proposals sent by several institutions from both universities, aims the building of three-dimensional maps of the Universe through galaxy surveys and studies of turbulence and magnetic fields, while strengthening the existing collaborations and increase the visibility of our institutions, including students and post-docs in a vigorous program of visits and workshops..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Raul Abramo - Integrante / Laerte Sodre Jr. (co-PI) - Integrante / JAMES STONE (co-PI) - Integrante / Michael Strauss (co-PI) - Integrante.
2011 - 2013
Magnetic Field Effects And Particle Acceleration in Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBS): Theory, Numerical Simulations, and Observational Prospects
Descrição: Joint Proposal FAPESP-HEBREW University of Jerusalem (HUJ) (process: 2011/51275-4): Supersonic jets are ubiquitous in the Universe as they are associated to a wide variety of astrophysical objects - from young stars to gamma-ray-bursts (GRBs). In particular, GRBs are the most energetic and probably most mysterious phenomena in the cosmos and in this joint Proposal with Prof. T. Piran of HUJ, one of the most prominent experts in the world in GRBs theory, we aim to investigate several aspects of the physics of the ultrarelativistic jets associated to GRBs. In this context, we plan to study: magnetic field reconnection, magnetic turbulence, MHD dynamics of jets, and particle acceleration by collisionless magnetized shocks and by magnetic reconnection within the relativistic regime. This project will maximize the synergy between the two groups. The research will involve both analytic techniques and numerical simulations. It will also involve analysis of astronomical satellite data concerning GRBs and the possibility to make theoretical predictions for the coming CTA (Cherenkov Telescope Array) gamma-ray observatory..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Tsvi Piran - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2010 - Atual
CTA - Cherenkov Telescope Array
Descrição: CTA is an international collaboration involving 24 countries which intends to construct a new generation of ground based gamma ray telescopes to investigate astrophysical compact sources, the origin of dark matter, and cosmic rays and cosmic magnetism, among other subjects of astrophysical interest. The plan is to build hundreds of telescopes in three different configurations in order to detect gamma rays with energies between 10 GeV and 100 TeV. The CTA experiment, which will have 10 times more sensitivity than any currently operating gamma ray telescope, is presently at the study phase and choice of sites. Among these Argentina is a strong candidate to host the CTA branch in the south hemisphere. The prototype phase should start in the middle of the next year and the construction should begin in 2013. Recently, a Brazilian group of scientists has been invited as member of CTA (member of the Brazilian board) ..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador.
2010 - Atual
LLAMA - Large Latin American Millimetric Array
Descrição: Thsi project approved by FAPESP (Thematic Project) is a Brazilian-Argentinean Collaboration aiming at the Installation of an ALMA-like antenna in the Argentinean Andes in order to do millimetric and sub-millimetric observations and also very long baseline interferometic (VLBI) observations combining with ALMA which will allow an increase in sensitivity with regard to the latter of a factor around 10.i.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Integrante / Jacques Lepine - Coordenador / Zulema Abraham - Integrante / Guillermo Gimenz - Integrante.
2009 - 2013
PLANCK SATELLITE MISSION
Descrição: The PLANCK SATELLITE launched in 2008 was designed to make precision measurements of the cosmic background radiation. A  Memorandum  of  Understanding  (MoU)    was subscribed  between  the Planck Satellite Consorcium and A.M.  Magalhães. F. Poidevin, and E.M. de  Gouveia  Dal  Pino,  referred  to  as  External  Collaborators,  and  M. Giard,  J.­Ph.  Bernard,  F.  Boulanger,  known  as  Planck  Leaders,  to  enable  a  productive  scientific  collaboration  in  the  framework  of  PLANCK  Projects  WG7  frame proposal,  Dust  properties from polarization, magnetic field in interstellar clouds. .
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador.
2009 - 2012
UM CLUSTER DE COMPUTADORES PARA O DEPARTAMENTO DE ASTRONOMIA DO IAG/USP E PARA O NÜCLEO DE ASTRONOMIA DA UNICSUL
Descrição: O projeto enquadra-se no Programa Equipamentos Multiusuários da FAPESP e destina-se à aquisição de um super-cluster para o Departamento de Astronomia e também para o Núcleo de Astrfíscia da UnicSul destinado sobretudo à realização de modelagem numérica de fontes e meios astrofísicos (coordenação: Elisabete de Gouveia Dal Pino; FAPESP 2009/54006-4)..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2008 - 2012
Observational mission for constraining dust polarization and magnetic field properties of the foreground for cosmological studies
Descrição: Brazilian-French observational/theoretical collaboration under an USP-COFECUB agreement. The main goal of the proposal is to combine measurements from the southern hemisphere survey of the ISM optical/near-IR polarization of the Galaxy which is being undertaken by IAG-USP with polarized emission data that will be obtained at sub-millimetric wavelengths by the Planck satellite of the European Space Agency (ESA) launched in April 2009, and by the PILOT experiment to be launched on board of a stratospheric balloon by the French team 2010 (CESR, Toulouse)..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Integrante / Antonio Mario Magalhaes - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): COFECUB - Auxílio financeiro.
2006 - 2012
Investigation of High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics Phenomena: Theory, Observation, and Numerical Simulations
Descrição: Projeto Tematico FAPESP (n. proc. 2006/50654-3).
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Adriana Valio - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2006 - 2012
GEMINI/NICI extrasolar planet finding campaign
Descrição: Brazilian-French observational/theoretical collaboration under an USP-COFECUB agreement. The French team is composed by Drs. Jean-Philippe Bernard, Martin Giard and Isabelle Ristorcelli of CESR, and Nicolas Ponthieu of the Institut d?Astrophysique Spatiale, Un. Paris-Sud, as well as by the post-docs and Jonathan Aumont of CESR and the PhD student Yingjie Peng CESR. The Brazilian team is composed by Profs. Antonio Mario Magalhães (PI) and Elisabete M. de Gouveia Dal Pino (PI) of IAG-USP, Diego Falceta-Goncalves (UnicSul), and Thyrso Villela (INPE); the post-docs Grzegorz Kowal (IAG-USP), Frederick Poidevin (IAG-USP), and Antonio Pereyra (ON); and the PhD students Lívia S. C. A. Ferreira, Márcia M. R. Leão, and Reinaldo Santos-Lima of IAG-USP. The main goal of the proposal is to combine measurements from the southern hemisphere survey of the ISM optical/near-IR polarization of the Galaxy which is being undertaken by IAG-USP with polarized emission data that will be obtained at sub-millimetric wavelengths by the PLANCK satellite of the European Space Agency (ESA) launched in the current year, and by the PILOT experiment to be launched on board of a stratospheric balloon by the French team (CESR, Toulouse)..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (4) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Antonio Mario Magalhaes - Integrante.


Projetos de desenvolvimento
2014 - Atual
ASTRI Mini-Array: the CTA Precursor
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Desenvolvimento.
Alunos envolvidos: Técnico de nível médio: (1) Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (2) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2009 - Atual
LONG LATIN AMERICAN MILLIMETRIC ARRAY (LLAMA)
Descrição: Installation of 2 antennae for millimeter and sub-millimeter wavelengths in NS Argentinian Desert at high altitueds for use in single or in VLBI experiments with ALMA. This millimeter/sub-millimeter radiotelescope, at high altitude in the NW desert of Argentina will be used for research in every field area of astronomy, i.e., for studies of the solar system, stellar evolution, interstellar media, extragalactic astronomy. As part of an interferometer associated with ALMA, it will reach the highest angular resolution in Astronomy, of the order of 1 milli-arc-second at 1 millimeter wavelengths..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Desenvolvimento.

Integrantes: Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Integrante / Jacques Lepine - Coordenador / Zulema Abraham - Integrante / Felix Mirabel - Integrante / Marcelo Arnal - Integrante / Ricardo Morras - Integrante / Gustavo Romero - Integrante.
